name: sippet
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small piece of bread that has been fried or toasted (= heated until the outside is hard and brown): The stew was served with sippets of toasted bread scattered around the surface. I used a sippet to soak up the gravy from the casserole.
More examplesFewer examplesThe chef had added chopped cucumbers, peppers, and sippets to the soup.She put a few sippets of bread onto the plate and poured gravy over them.He took a sippet and dipped it in the stew.
